To flesh out the setting, [[ The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game]] introduces many new types of plants and herbs that were used for various purposes, beyond [[reeds]].
==Aelgus==
'''''Aelgus''''' was a small, green, leafy fern that grew in thick patches throughout [[Arnor]]. Once cultivated by the [[Númenóreans]] like [[athelas]], it was later considered a nuisance by farmers and shepherds. Properly prepared and eaten, it induced vomiting that purged venom and neutralized poisons.<ref>{{Decipher|Wise}}, p. 84</ref>

==Eater’s Leaf==
'''''Eater’s Leaf''''' was an herb found in the [[Old Forest]] and valued in [[The Shire|the Shire]], especially by the [[Brandybuck family|Brandybucks]]. It fortified the digestive system, allowing heavy consumption of food and drink without ill effects, and granted resistance against poisons.<ref name="secondpage">{{Decipher|Wise}}, p. 85</ref>

==Equial==
'''''Equial''''' ([[Sindarin|S.]] ''sídhroch'', “horse-rest”) was a hardy weed found on the eastern slopes of the [[Misty Mountains]]. Used by the Rohirrim, it served as a mild anaesthetic for calming horses and other mounts. Frequent use, however, could prove deadly.<ref name="secondpage"/>

==Fresh Dew==
'''''Fresh Dew''''' ([[Sindarin|S.]] ''amrúnan'', “sunrise-gift”) was a small, leafy plant growing high in the Misty Mountains. Crushed, it produced a pungent odour that revived the weary. It could rouse the stunned or even restore those collapsed from exhaustion.<ref>{{Decipher|Wise}}, pp. 85-86</ref>

==Gwathlas==
'''''Gwathlas''''' ([[Sindarin|S.]] “shadow-leaf”) was a leafy plant with a thick root, first cultivated by the [[Black Númenóreans]] under [[Sauron]]’s tutelage. Consuming the oil from its compressed roots sharpened the mind, allowing sorcerers to study dark lore more efficiently. In [[Gondor]], its use was outlawed and punishable by death.<ref name="thirdpage">{{Decipher|Wise}}, p. 86</ref>

==Naurant==
'''''Naurant''''' ([[Sindarin|S.]] “red-vein”) was a fern with crimson veins, found east of the Sirich River. Gondorian healers employed it as a sedative. <ref name="thirdpage"/>

==Soldier’s Root==
'''''Soldier’s Root''''' ([[Sindarin|S.]] ''dagorthond'', “battle-root”) was a rare plant with an orange, pulpy root, found along the [[Bruinen|Loudwater]] near [[Rivendell]]. It granted great strength but carried the dangerous side-effect of battle-fury, often leading to excessive violence. This led to Elves purging the plant on sights.<ref>{{Decipher|Wise}}, p. 87</ref>
